cabins.title: Big Ridge Rustic Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Come enjoy a lakeside vacation rental at Big Ridge State Park. Visitors will enjoy hiking on the ridges overlooking Norris Lake and spending time out on the water. Located just north of Knoxville, this is the perfect place to enjoy the beauty and history of East Tennessee.

The park has twenty (20) one-bedroom rustic cabins that are open from April 1 through October 31. Eighteen (18) of the cabins can accommodate six people each. Cabin 11 accommodates four people and Cabin 2 accomodates eight people. The cabins were built in 1936 by the Civilian Conservation Corps and retain the charm and design of that time. Five cabins are located on the lakeside and fifteen (15) sit on the ridge.

Most of the cabins have a combined living and sleeping area with two double beds and a sofa sleeper. They feature hardwood floors, screened-in porches, bathrooms with tub/shower combination, and full kitchens with refrigerator, stove, toaster, and coffee maker. The cabins are fully equipped with linens, cookware, cooking utensils and grill. All cabins have air conditioning and electric heat along with a fireplace. Firewood is provided seasonally. There are no televisions or phones.

Cabins are available by reservation only and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Parking is extremely limited. Do not attempt to tow or park a trailer in the cabin area. Most cabins require a set of stairs to get to and from the parking area. Pets are only permitted in Cabin 6 and 13.

cabins.title: Cedars of Lebanon Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Cedars of Lebanon has nine two-bedroom cabins accommodating up to five people. They are fully furnished with a complete kitchen, living area, and one bathroom. There is a queen-sized bed downstairs, a king-sized bed upstairs, and a twin in the loft.

Each cabin is fully equipped for housekeeping. The kitchen has a stove, a refrigerator, a microwave, a coffeemaker, and all cooking utensils. Visitors only need to bring their own groceries. The living area has a flat-screen television, two couches and a fireplace with gas logs. All linens and towels are provided.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 8 and 9.

cabins.title: Cedars of Lebanon Ricketts Historical Cabin
cabins.cabin_description:
Visitors to Cedars of Lebanon State Park are often struck by the beauty of the historic architecture. Many of the buildings were constructed in the 1930's in that classic period of park growth and development. While the other cabins within the park were built many years later, the Ricketts historical cabin maintains much of the beauty and charm of that original park architecture.

The Ricketts historical cabin is perfect for newlyweds, anniversaries, or a special occasion getaway. With its rustic log cabin look tucked in the trees and cozy set up, you won't be disappointed! The Ricketts Historical Cabin built in the 1930s is set up for two people with one common room with a king size bed, chairs, TV, electric log fireplace, full kitchen and a bathroom supplied with all amenities for comfort. You can enjoy relaxing on the cedar porch in rocking chairs while watching for passing deer and birds.

cabins.title: Chickasaw Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Chickasaw offers 13 historic Works Progress Administration (WPA) cabins nestled among tall pines and located within easy access to Lake Placid.

Seven of the cabins are one-bedroom with two twin beds. A double bed is located in the living area of the cabin. These cabins will accommodate up to four people.

The six two-bedroom cabins will sleep up to six people. One bedroom has a double bed and the other has two twin beds. The couch in the living room contains a fold out queen bed.

The kitchens contain full sized appliances as well as utensils for cooking and serving. All of your bed and bath linens are provided and these items can be exchanged out for new linen by contacting our housekeeping staff.

In the main living area is a wood burning fireplace and wood is provided October to March. The cabin also contains a TV with satellite service and a telephone. Adjacent to the cabin is a deck overlooking the surrounding area as well as a picnic table, fire ring, and grill.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round. Cabins can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time for the cabin is 3:00PM and check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabin 6, 7, and 8.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain - Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
DELUXE

Cumberland Mountain State Park has eight deluxe cabins. These cabins are fully furnished with all dishes, cooking utensils, linens, and central heat and air.

Each cabin has two bedrooms and two baths. There is a king-size bed in one bedroom, and two full-size beds in the other bedroom. Each cabin accommodates up to six people.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Coon Hollow Cabin
cabins.cabin_description:
COON HOLLOW

Coon Hollow is currently being renovated. The Coon Hollow Cabin can accommodate six people. It has two bedrooms upstairs and one bedroom downstairs with a double bed in each bedroom. It is fully furnished with all cooking utensils, linens, fireplace, and central heat and air. The fireplace is temporarily unavailable for use due to ongoing reconstruction.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Duplexes
cabins.cabin_description:
DUPLEX CABINS

Cumberland Mountain has eight duplex cabins. These cabins sleep two people. Each cabin has one full bed, a kitchenette, and a bathroom. There is a shared wall with the adjoining duplex unit, but no interior access. Linens, dishes, and utensils are provided and all have air conditioning. Each has a picnic table, a grill, and parking.

Duplexes are cabins 17a, 17b, 18a, 18b, 19a, 19b, 20a, and 20b.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Historic CCC Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
HISTORIC CCC CABINS

The historic CCC cabins truly capture the beauty and heritage of Cumberland Mountain State Park. These cabin vacation rentals on the Cumberland Plateau are located just minutes off I-40, but transport visitors back to the time. The entire park exists as a testament to the beauty and architectural achievements of the Civilian Conservation Corps. These cabins perfectly capture the timeless beauty of park architecture with modern amenities and updates.

Visitors will enjoy the way Byrd Lake forms the central feature of the park. Activities like fishing, paddling, mountain biking, hiking, and golfing on a Jack Nicklaus signature course will make this a wonderful vacation destination for any traveler. The park also serves as a great launch point for other adventures in the area, like waterfall chasing at Ozone Falls or rock climbing at Black Mountain. Whatever your adventure, you are sure to find it at Cumberland Mountain State Park.

There are 11 historic CCC cabins. All have been recently renovated. There is a king bed in the common area and one twin bed in a separate bedroom. Linens are provided. Amenities include a fireplace and a new refrigerator, oven, stovetop, dishwasher, and coffee maker. Outside there is a picnic table and a grill. Parking is provided in front of each cabin.

Historic CCC cabins are numbers one, two, three, four, five, six, nine, 10, 11, 13, and 14.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Mill House Cabin
cabins.cabin_description:
MILL HOUSE

This cabin is currently being renovated. Once completed the house will accommodate up to 6 people. It is a two-story cabin with two bedrooms and 1.5 baths. The fireplace is temporarily unavailable due to ongoing reconstruction. The Mill House will have central heat and air conditioning.

The Mill House is fully furnished with dishes, cooking utensils and linens. The cabin has a patio on the backside that faces the creek. Mill House Cabin is not close to any of the other cabins.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
STANDARD CABINS

Five standard cabins are nestled among the trees. Cabins have two bedrooms, each with a double bed. Linens are provided. Capacity is four people. A full kitchen, fireplace, picnic table, and grill round out the amenities. Firewood is available October 1 through April 30. Parking is available in front of each cabin. Standard cabins are 7, 8, 12, 15, and 16.

cabins.title: Cumberland Mountain Timber Lodge
cabins.cabin_description:
TIMBER LODGE CABINS

The park has three Timber Lodge log cabins overlooking Byrd Lake. These Timber Lodge cabins consist of three bedrooms and one full bath. Two bedrooms contain two double beds and the third bedroom has one double bed, accommodating up to 10 people. Each cabin is fully furnished with all dishes, cooking utensils, linens and central heat and air.

cabins.title: David Crockett Premium Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
David Crockett is proud to feature seven modern cabins near beautiful Lake Lindsey. Available year-round, each cabin is completely furnished with two bedrooms, two baths and a full kitchen and a covered patio. These unique modern accommodations were designed and built with energy efficiency in mind. They are the first Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certified vacation homes in the eastern United States or available at a state park.

The energy efficient cabins are heated and cooled by a Geo-Thermally powered HVAC unit. The gas fireplaces will be available from November 1 until March 31 in order for the park to meet LEEDS and GREEN Certification requirements for energy conservation.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabin 6.

cabins.title: Edgar Evins Economy Suites
cabins.cabin_description:
Edgar Evins State Park cabin rentals sit on the shoreline overlooking Center Hill Lake. Located just 65 miles east of Nashville, Edgar Evins is an ideal destination for kayaking, canoeing, boating and hiking while relaxing on the water. It is an easy and convenient cabin rental option for anyone looking to enjoy the Caney Fork River. In the summer months, cabin guests can even enjoy exclusive access to the park's swimming pool. There is a marina on the park that operates slip rentals, boat rentals, and a restaurant. Plus, the spiraling staircase ascending from the Visitor Center up above the treeline and overlooking the lake is one of those iconic Tennessee State Park experiences you won't want to miss.

The suites are similar to condos. They are a split-level design with the kitchen and living area on the upper level and the bedroom on the lower level with the bathroom by the entrance foyer. Each suite can accommodate six adults with two double beds in the bedroom and a sofa sleeper in the living room. The suites are located across a six-building lodging complex. Five buildings house six one-bedroom suites and one building contains four one-bedroom suites.

The suites are completely equipped for housekeeping including linens, appliances and cooking and serving utensils. All the suites have satellite TV, central heat and air conditioning and a balcony. There is one double barbeque grill in front of each building available on a first come first served basis.

There are no assigned parking spaces per unit, parking is on a first come first served basis. The park's courtesy dock for cabin guests provides 16 boat slips that are available on a first come first served basis. There are no assigned slips per unit.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Suites B1, B2, B3, B4, B5 and B6. Absolutely no grills allowed on the balcony at any time.

cabins.title: Fall Creek Falls Fisherman Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Upon arrival, please check-in at the Park Office, located in The Village. Click here to view area map.

Prepared food is available at The Village pool snack bar and FCF Golf Course Pro Shop. Groceries are sold at the camp store in The Village. Fall Creek Falls t-shirts, caps and other souvenirs are available at our two gift shops; one is located at the park office and one located at the camper check-in building.

One landside cabin and one three-bedroom fisherman cabin is accessible to persons with a disability. Ten cabins (4 landside cabins, 3 three bedroom fisherman cabins and 3 two bedroom fisherman cabins) are available to guests with pets and all service animals are allowed. Cabins have a minimum two-night stay requirement.

Fisherman Cabins

Fall Creek Falls has twenty cabins located directly on Fall Creek Lake, which are known as the ";Fishermen Cabins."; Ten of these cabins are two-story, two bedrooms, one and a half bath cabins. The other ten cabins are one-story, three bedrooms, two bath cabins. Fisherman Cabin guests can enjoy outdoor cooking, sunbathing, and fishing from their private porches situated out over the lake. WiFi is available.

On the lower floor of the two-bedroom Fishermen Cabins is a full kitchen, dining area and living room with a pot belly woodstove and the full bath. Upstairs are the two bedrooms and the half bath. Inside one bedroom are two full-XL beds and the other bedroom has one king size bed.

The three-bedroom cabins (also often referred to as villas) consist of a master bedroom with two queen beds, a private bath, and a private balcony. Across the living room are two bedrooms that share a bath. One of these bedrooms contains two queen beds, while the other has a single queen bed.

cabins.title: Fall Creek Falls Landside Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Landside Cabins

There are also ten one-story, two-bedroom cabins located on a wooded hill overlooking the lake known as the ";Landside Cabins."; Each Landside Cabin has a gas fireplace and is complete with patio, picnic table, and grill for cooking and dining outdoors. WiFi is available.

  • Inside one bedroom are two full-XL beds and the other bedroom has one king size bed.
  • Landside cabins have two playgrounds and a basketball court. Horseshoe pits are available.

cabins.title: Henry Horton Rustic Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Henry Horton State Park features five rustic cabins. Each cabin is fully equipped for housekeeping, including appliances, cooking utensils, linens, and towels. All cabins have a picnic table and a charcoal grill. Cribs are available upon request.

The rustic cabins (#1, #2, #3, #6 and #7) have two bedrooms, each with a queen-sized bed, living room with sleeper sofa, one bath, full kitchen, wood-burning fireplaces, window air conditioners, and phones. Cabins #1 and #2 are pet-friendly.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time is 4:00 p.m. and check-out time is 10:00 a.m.

Cabins are equipped with: Pots and pans, Baking sheet, Baking pan, Silverware, Cooking utensils, Plates, Glasses and coffee cups, Coffee pot, Toaster, Can opener, Microwave, Dish soap & Sponge, Dishtowels, Trash bags, Potholders, Bar soap, Toilet paper, Salt & Pepper.

cabins.title: Henry Horton Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Henry Horton State Park has three standard cabins. Each cabin is fully equipped for housekeeping, including appliances, cooking utensils, linens, and towels, (complete list below). Each cabin has a picnic table and a charcoal grill. Cribs are available upon request.

Cabins #4 and #5 have two bedrooms, each with a queen-sized bed, living room, two bathrooms, full kitchen, central heat and air, gas fireplace and phone. Each cabin also has a sleeper sofa. Cabin #4 is handicap accessible.

Cabin #8 has three bedrooms and one bathroom. Each bedroom has a queen-size bed. The cabin has central heat and air, full kitchen, microwave, side-by-side refrigerator/freezer, gas fireplace, and carport.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time is 4:00 p.m. and check-out time is 10:00 a.m.

Cabins are equipped with: Pots and pans, Baking sheet, Baking pan, Silverware, Cooking utensils, Plates, Glasses and coffee cups, Coffee pot, Toaster, Can opener, Microwave, Dish soap & Sponge, Dishtowels, Trash bags, Potholders, Bar soap, Toilet paper, Salt & Pepper.

cabins.title: Historic Cottage at Norris Dam
cabins.cabin_description:
The historic cottage is a tranquil space that features a rustic stone cut front porch that overlooks the historic district, located on the east side of the park, just past the Tea Room. Historically known as the Park Superintendent's dwelling, the original portion of the house constructed by the Civilian Conservation Corp (CCC) in the 1930s. Step back in time while enjoying the modern amenities, such as a fully equipped kitchen and laundry room, living room with wood-burning fireplace, formal dining room, two bedrooms—one with two full-size beds, and one with a queen-size bed, and a double vanity make-up room for bridal parties. Enjoy the secluded back porch with a private park setting, as well as a fire pit with Adirondack chairs for those cool crisp evenings.

This cabin also features a flat-screen television that includes local channels, gas heat, and A/C. One bundle of firewood is provided the 1st night during the winter season. Pets are not permitted in the historic cottage.

cabins.title: Meeman-Shelby Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Meeman-Shelby Forest has six two-bedroom standard cabins situated along the shoreline of Poplar Tree Lake in a heavily wooded section of the park. These newly renovated cabins can sleep up to four people. They have two bedrooms that each have one bed along with one full size pull out couch. In cabins 1 - 5, the beds are queen size. In cabin 6, the beds are full size. These cozy cabins are ideal for a family vacations, couples' weekend, fishing trip, or a girls' getaway.

The Meeman-Shelby Forest cabins are completely equipped for housekeeping with a fully equipped kitchen. Linens are provided. Firewood is supplied during the winter months. Want to add a jon boat to your cabin rental? Call us at 901-876-5215 to reserve one!

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 1 and 5.

cabins.title: Montgomery Bell Premium Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The eight premium cabins at Montgomery Bell State Park have two bedrooms and two full baths. These cabins come with a fully equipped kitchen that includes a dishwasher, microwave, full refrigerator, toaster and coffee maker.

The cabins sleep up to eight people. The master bedroom has a king size bed and the second bedroom is equipped with two queen size beds. The great room also has a queen sofa sleeper for additional sleeping capacity. Both bedrooms and great room have a flat screen TV.

Each cabin has a large covered patio with an outdoor fireplace and gas grill. The swimming pool at the Lodge is available to Lodge and cabin guests.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 151 and 157.

cabins.title: Natchez Trace Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Natchez Trace has 10 deluxe two bedroom, two bath cabins situated on Pin Oak Lake. Each cabin is two-stories and can accommodate six people comfortably. The downstairs bedroom has two queen beds along with a bath and the upstairs bedroom has one queen bed with access to a bath.

Also there is a fully equipped kitchen with cookware and utensils to serve six people. There is a spacious living room with cable TV and a gas fireplace in the living room area, but please note that the fireplace is turned off from April through October. On the balcony overlooking the lake, there is a gas grill with table and chairs. Every two cabins share a boat dock. All towels and linens are provided.

The swimming pool at the Lodge is available to cabin guests.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 601 and 610.

cabins.title: Natchez Trace Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Natchez Trace has 17 standard cabins nestled among tall trees on beautiful Cub Lake. These cabins have one bedroom with a queen bed, accommodating up two people.

The cabins are completely equipped for housekeeping with full modern bathrooms, kitchen appliances, cooking utensils, linens, and towels. Each cabin has a grill and picnic table. They are air-conditioned and also have electric fireplaces.

The public beach and day-use area are located just across an arm of the lake and are accessible via a rustic footbridge.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 12, 13, 14, and 15.

cabins.title: Nathan Bedford Forrest Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Nathan Bedford Forrest State Park features seven deluxe cabins. Each cabin can sleep up to eight people with two bedrooms with two full-size beds in each room and two full baths. Each cabin has a fully furnished kitchen, air conditioning, gas log fireplace, cable television, Wi-Fi, phone. There is also an outside grill and a deck facing the river. Bed and bath linens are provided although there is no maid service.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 2 and 3.

cabins.title: Nathan Bedford Forrest Rustic Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Nathan Bedford Forrest State Park has one Rustic Log Cabin available that can sleep up to four people. It is located on a secluded ridge overlooking Kentucky Lake. The historic cabin is a renovated 1930's log cabin that features a full-sized bed, pullout couch, a wood burning fireplace, a full bathroom, full kitchen and a covered back porch complete with a glider and a view of Kentucky Lake. Make your reservations early as this is the park's most popular cabin.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM.

cabins.title: Norris Dam Historic CCC Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The park has 19 historic CCC cabins. The historic cabins were originally constructed in the 1930s by the Civilian Conservation Corps and are listed on the National Register of Historic Places. All are located in quiet, wooded settings and are completely equipped with electrical appliances, cooking/eating utensils, and linens.

These historic cabins have a combination living area, kitchenette, and bedroom with some cabins having a separate bedroom off of the porch, and a bathroom with a stand-up shower. Amenities include a television with local channels, fireplace, electric heaters, and window air conditioning units. Each cabin has a picnic table, grill, and fire pit. Cabins do not have telephones. One bundle of firewood is provided for the 1st night ​during the winter season. Additional firewood can be purchased at the park office visitors center.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins R10 and R12. The cabins allowing pets must be requested at the time of reservation. The A cabins have a double bed with a maximum occupancy of two, including children. The AA cabins have two double beds with a maximum occupancy of four, including children. No pets are allowed in cabins or in the cabin area except in the designated pet-friendly rustic cabins.

cabins.title: Norris Dam Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
These ten cabins have three bedrooms, each with a double bed, one bathroom, living room combined with dining area and kitchen. Each cabin has a small porch, picnic table, grill and fire pit.

Amenities include a microwave, television with local channels, gas fireplace during winter months and central heat and air. All cooking/eating utensils and linens are provided. Cabins do not have telephones.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabin 9. No pets are allowed in cabins or in cabin area except in the designated pet friendly standard cabin. A cabin allowing pets must be requested at the time of reservation. The maximum occupancy per cabin is six, including children.

cabins.title: Paris Landing Camping Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Paris Landing State Park features six (6) one room lakeside camping cabins. These cabins are the perfect destination for a camping experience with some of the comforts of home!

The camping cabins offer two (2) XL full size beds that can accommodate up to four (4) people. They are located in the Paris Landing State Park Campground and have access to the bathhouse. They have a microwave, mini fridge, table, climate control, and coffee pot. No linens are provided. All cabins are pet-friendly.

cabins.title: Paris Landing Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Paris Landing State Park features 10 three-bedroom, two bath standard cabins accommodating up to ten people. All cabins are situated with views of the Kentucky Lake.

The master bedroom contains 2 beds and has an attached bathroom. One of the additional bedrooms has two beds and the third contains one bed. Each of these additional bedrooms are located next to the second bathroom.

Each cabin is fully equipped for housekeeping with linens. There is a full kitchens with cooking and serving utensils. The cabin also features a gas log fireplace, telephone, cable TV, central heat, and air conditioning.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 609 and 610.

cabins.title: Pickett Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The Deluxe cabins have three bedrooms with four beds to sleep up to 8 people. The master bedroom has one king sized bed, second bedroom has one king size bed, and the third bedroom has two double beds. These cabins also have a kitchen, dining room, living room, two bathrooms, and an open-air covered porch on the back of the cabin. They are equipped with cooking utensils, linens, and a television with cable service. The units have central heat and air conditioning, as well as a gas fireplace.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in designated pet-friendly cabins.

cabins.title: Pickett Economy Suites
cabins.cabin_description: The five suites are adjoining with interconnecting doors for those who have two or more reserved. Each individual unit has one bedroom and bathroom upstairs, and a living room and kitchenette downstairs. They also have a back patio. These units are equipped with cooking utensils and linen. The units have central heat and air conditioning. They also have a wood-burning stove, which can be used from October 1 through March 31. Guests can purchase certified heat treated firewood from the park, or are welcome to bring their own certified heat treated firewood. The units do not have a television or telephone. They sleep between 1-2 people.

cabins.title: Pickett Historic CCC Stone Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
PICKETT HISTORIC CCC STONE CABINS

The historic CCC stone cabins are # 2, #3, and #5. These cabins have a full-size bed in the bedroom and a full-size bed in the living room and accommodate up to four people.

The Civilian Conservation Corps built these cabins in the 1930s as part of Roosevelt's famed New Deal Program during the Great Depression. The historic CCC cabins are equipped with central heat and air conditioning, cooking utensils, and linens. Each of the CCC stone cabins has a wood-burning fireplace, which can be used from October 1 through March 31. Guests can purchase certified heat-treated firewood from the park, or are welcome to bring their own certified heat-treated firewood. These cabins are not equipped with a television or telephone. The historic CCC cabins have screened in porches and have charcoal grills and picnic tables located near each cabin.

cabins.title: Pickett Historic CCC Wood Shingle Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
PICKETT HISTORIC CCC WOOD SHINGLE CABINS

The historic wood shingle cabins are #1 and #4. These cabins have one king-size bed in the living room/bedroom area and accommodate up to two people.

The Civilian Conservation Corps built these cabins in the 1930s, as part of Roosevelt's famed New Deal Program during the Great Depression. All of the historic CCC cabins are equipped with central heat and air conditioning, cooking utensils, and linens. Each of the CCC wood shingle cabins has a fireplace, which can be used from October 1 through November 30. Guests can purchase certified heat-treated firewood from the park, or are welcome to bring their own certified heat-treated firewood. These cabins are not equipped with a television or telephone. The historic CCC cabins have screened in porches and have charcoal grills and picnic tables located near each cabin.

cabins.title: Pickett Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Two of our standard cabins (#'s 8 and 10) have two bedrooms. Each of the two bedrooms has one double bed.

Three of our standard cabins (#'s 6, 7, and 9) have three bedrooms. One room with a king bed and two rooms with double beds.

The standard cabins also have a kitchen, bathroom, and dining room/living room. These cabins are equipped with cooking utensils and linens. Each of these cabins has central heat and air conditioning. They also have a fireplace, which can be used year-round. Guests can purchase certified heat treated firewood from the park, or are welcome to bring their own certified heat treated firewood. These cabins do not have a television or telephone. These cabins sleep 4-6 people.

cabins.title: Pickwick Landing Premium Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Book today for your next getaway

Pickwick Landing's seven premium cabins offer first-class comfort and modern convenience. All cabins have spacious living, dining and kitchen areas, and a choice of two or three bedrooms. Bedrooms have a combination of bed sizes. Some have four queen-size beds and some have two queen-size beds and one king-size.

Guests can enjoy views of the lake while relaxing in the living room or out on the patio. Kitchens have a full-size refrigerator and stove, microwave, coffeemaker, and dishwasher. All cookware, dishes, and linens are provided. Each cabin has WiFi, a gas grill, patio table and chairs, cable TV, central heat and air, and a gas fireplace.

Cabin guests may use the indoor and outdoor swimming pools at the Lodge. The newly renovated Restaurant and bar at the Lodge serves classic favorites and is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner seven days a week. An assortment of wines by the glass and bottle are available at the Restaurant along with domestic, local, craft and imported beers and a unique selection of craft cocktails. In addition, the Lodge at Pickwick Landing State Park offers free shuttle service from the restaurant to the marina.

If you have questions about making a reservation or cabin availability, please give us a call. We will be happy to reserve a cabin for you.

Pets: Please note that pets are not allowed in the Premium Cabins.

cabins.title: Pickwick Landing Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Pickwick Landing has 10 standard cabins that feature two bedrooms and one bathroom. One bedroom has a king bed and the second bedroom has two queen beds, accommodating up to six people. The cabins also have a full kitchen, central heat, and air, patio, outdoor grill, cable TV, and fireplace. All cookware, dishes, and linens are provided.

Guests in the cabins enjoy all lodge privileges, including the use of the tennis courts and the indoor and outdoor swimming pool.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 9 and 10.

cabins.title: Reelfoot Lake Premium Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The park has seven (7) cabins that offer first-class comfort and modern convenience on the shoreline of Reelfoot Lake. All cabins have spacious living, dining and kitchen areas and a choice of two- or three-bedrooms. Cabins accommodate 6-8 people depending on design. Amenities include two full bathrooms, full size kitchens, dishwasher, central heat and air, an electric fireplace, outdoor charcoal grills, and patios. All cabins have lakeside views and are pet-friendly. The cabins are also equipped with cable TV and WiFi service.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in pet-friendly cabins. Two ADA cabins are available and should be requested when reservations are made.

cabins.title: Roan Mountain Standard Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Thirty deluxe cabins are situated in the woods of Roan Mountain State Park. Each cabin has a front porch with rocking chairs, a full bath with tub/shower, a wood-burning stove, and gas/electric heat. Bedding and towels are provided by the park. Linen exchange is available for a fee of $20 but must be paid upon your arrival. The kitchen has a stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, and basic cooking and eating utensils. Cabins 1-20 provide utensils for six people. Cabins 21-30 provide utensils for eight people. The cabins have fans but are not air-conditioned. None of the cabins have televisions.

  • Cabins 1-20 have a private bedroom with a queen bed and an upstairs loft with two twin beds. These can sleep up to four people.
  • Cabins 21-30 have a private bedroom with a queen bed and a loft with two double beds. These cabins have telephones available. These can sleep up to six people.

To see a list of kitchen inventory items, click on one of the following links:

  • Inventory List for Cabins 1 - 20
  • Inventory List for Cabins 21-30

The park will provide wood for cabins on Monday's and Thursday's ONLY. If you need wood in between those days, firewood is available for purchase at the camp store April 15th through October 31st, and at the park office beginning November 1st through April 15th.

Cabin pathways are not accessible by vehicles. Carts are provided in the cabin parking areas for transporting your luggage, and the longest distance is approximately 200 yards.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance for groups with five cabins or more. Check-out time is 10:00 a.m.. Pets are only permitted in designated pet-friendly cabins.

cabins.title: Rock Island Premium Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Rock Island State Park features 10 cabins located a half-mile from natural sand beach along the Caney Fork River. The three-bedroom, two-bath cabins sleep up to ten people and are completely equipped for housekeeping and include appliances, coffee pot, microwave, cooking utensils, dishes, and linens. Each cabin also features a fireplace with gas logs (seasonal), television, DVD player, and a charcoal grill.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in Cabins 1 and 2.

cabins.title: Standing Stone Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
Standing Stone State Park has seven three-bedroom deluxe cabins that are open year-round and sleep 8 to 10 people. All the deluxe cabins have one bathroom, central heat and air, a kitchen, and satellite television.

Four of the deluxe cabins have three double beds and two single beds, accommodating up to eight people.

Three of the deluxe cabins have four double beds and two single beds, accommodating up to ten people. These cabins also have a gas log fireplace (seasonal).

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time is 4:00PM and check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in pet-friendly cabins.

cabins.title: Standing Stone Rustic Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The park has 14 rustic cabins that can accommodate four to eight people. The cabins vary in size and layout. All of these cabins have central heat and air conditioning, kitchens, bathrooms, and gas log fireplaces (seasonal), but no television.

Ten of these rustic cabins ( 3,4,5,7,9,10,11,13,16,17) received complete kitchen and bathroom upgrades in October 2020, along with new windows, appliances, and furnishings. Hardwood floors throughout each cabin were refinished and new hardwood flooring was installed in each kitchen and bathroom.

The smallest of the cabins has two sets of single bunk beds and the largest includes four double beds, with various arrangements in between.

Please Note: November - March rustic cabins 2, 6, 13, 17, 18 and the Overton Lodge are not available for rent.

Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time is 4:00PM and check-out time is 10:00AM. Pets are only permitted in pet-friendly cabins.

cabins.title: Tims Ford Deluxe Cabins
cabins.cabin_description:
The park has 20 two-bedroom, one-bath cabins situated on the wooded slopes of Tims Ford Lake. The cabins are equipped with oven, stove, microwave, full-size refrigerator, cooking and serving utensils, coffee maker, toaster and linens. Every cabin features a seasonal gas fireplace, outdoor balcony, a charcoal grill and one TV with 12 channels of DirecTV.

  • Cabins 2 to 13 have two bedrooms; one with a king bed and the second with two full beds. (Occupancy = 6)
  • Cabins 14 to 19 have two bedrooms: both bedrooms have two full beds. (Occupancy = 8)
  • ADA Cabins 1 & 20 have two bedrooms: one with a full bed and the other with two full beds. (Occupancy = 6)
  • Our pet-friendly cabins are Cabins 1, 9, 13, 14.
RATES (INCLUDING TAXES)
  • Week Day Rates: $156.94/per night (Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday)
  • Weekend Rates: $180.19/per night (Friday and Saturday)
  • Peak Rates: $191.81/per night

Cabin discounts are only available on reservations made within 30 days of arrival date. Only one discount per cabin. Each discounted cabin must be occupied by a discount-eligible guest. Cabins are available by reservation year-round with a two-night minimum (holidays and other special events may require longer minimum stays) and can be reserved up to a year in advance online with reservations being made through the park office up to two years in advance. Check-in time is 4:00 PM and check-out time is 10:00 AM. Pets are only permitted in pet-friendly cabins.
